history.content:
Hi folks,

This fall I’m teaching a new class CS294-164, interdisciplinary with Berkeley Vision Science, called Computational Color. 
Meeting Times: Wednesdays 1-4pm
Location: TBD due to Soda Hall renovation schedule — please check website before first meeting

This course will have limited enrollment for graduate and undergraduate students in EECS, Vision Science, neuroscience or with interest in related fields. 

Couse Description:
  • This new course will provide a graduate-level introduction to color and topics related to its history, science, art and engineering.  Two themes will be: current research attempting to fundamentally extend the colors a person can see through novel computational imaging systems, and color processing in modern consumer imaging pipelines. A goal is to provide foundations for the pursuit of current research collaborations between EECS and vision science.  Topics to include: history of color theory and science, selected topics in vision science and neuroscience, colorimetry, color appearance models, color computations, camera pipelines, optics, hyperspectral imaging, ecological optics, optical illusions. This course will assume background in visual computing at a level of CS184, OR vision science at the level of VS 260A + VS 260D.
Enrollment Info:
  • Important: come to the first class if you are interested to take this class!  There is a problem with the calcentral enrollment system, and though the class looks fully enrolled, final enrollment has NOT been decided. The process is that all students interested should attend the first class.  Based on number and background of students, the instructor will decide whether to admit all or use a short application form. Enrollment will be sorted out by the second class. In the meantime, please join the waitlist to help planning — info on class webpage, link below. 
Here is a working draft (Berkeley login) of course and enrollment info:
  • https://docs.google.com/document/d/11DYga0it9uIf8kQUevIYOrQzsZKgrgX70MpL8l6Wsbc
Best regards, 
- Ren
